p: De Araujo et al. ( 198) tested by microdilution, extracts rich in tannins obtained from A. occidentale stem bark which inhibited cariogenic bacteria growth from the Streptococcus genus, obtaining a MIC of 3,125 μg/mL ( S. mitis, S. mutans) and of 6.25 μg/mL ( S. oralis, S. salivarius, S. sanguinis, and Streptococcus sobrinus). The 0.12% chlorhexidine control presented MICs ranging from 0.390 to 3,125 μg/mL.
